title: How to Make Italian Wedding Soup

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C).
steps.description: Grab a baking pan sheet. Coat with non-stick cooking spray.

text: Making the Meatballs Preheat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C). Grab a baking pan sheet. Coat with non-stick cooking spray. Beat the egg in a large bowl and combine with chives, sage, and garlic.  Add in ground beef, sausage, cheese, breadcrumbs, and salt.  Mix with hands until mixture is fully combined and smooth.  Roll the mixture in your hands into about a tablespoon-sized balls. They should be about an inch in diameter. Place each meatball on the baking tray. Bake for about 15 to 18 minutes, or until lightly brown. Then set aside. Making the Vegetable Soup Grab a large pot. Heat up olive oil on medium heat. Add the onions, carrots, and celery to the pot. Cook while stirring frequently until soft; this will take about 8 minutes. Add the chicken broth, beef broth, water, wine, bay leaf, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil. Add the pasta and leave the pot uncovered. Leave at a gentle boil until the pasta is al dente, about 8 to 10 minutes. Reduce the heat to low. Add the spinach and cooked meatballs to the soup. Simmer soup for 3 to 4 minutes, or until the spinach is wilted and meatballs are warmed. Ladle soup in bowls. Top with grated Parmigiano Reggiano if desired. Enjoy your meal!
